section.title: Introduction
section.para: This is technical reference documentation for the DocBook XSL Stylesheets; it documents (some of) the parameters, templates, and other elements of the stylesheets.

This reference describes each of the Formatting Object Stylesheet parameters. These are the easily customizable parts of the stylesheet. If you want to specify an alternate value for one or more of these parameters, you can do so in a driver stylesheet.
For example, if you want to turn on automatic section numbering, you might create a driver stylesheet like this:
Naturally, you have to change the href attribute on <xsl:import> to point to docbook.xsl on your system.
This is not intended to be user documentation. It is provided for developers writing customization layers for the stylesheets, and for anyone who's interested in how it works.
Although I am trying to be thorough, this documentation is known to be incomplete. Don't forget to read the source, too :-)

refnamediv.refpurpose: Extension for admonition graphics

refdescription.para: Sets the extension to use on admonition graphics.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Are divisions in QAndASets enumerated?

refdescription.para: If true (non-zero), unlabeled qandadivs will be enumerated.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Does enumeration of QandASet components inherit the numeration of parent elements?

refdescription.para: If true (non-zero), numbered QandADiv elements and Questions and Answers inherit the numeration of the ancestors of the QandASet.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Default extension for graphic filenames

refdescription.para: If a graphic or mediaobject includes a reference to a filename that does not include an extension, and the format attribute is unspecified, the default extension will be used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Properties of formal object titles

refdescription.para: This attribute set is used to specify the properties of formal object titles.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Properties of component titles

refdescription.para: This attribute set is used to specify the properties of component titles.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Properties of admonition titles

refdescription.para: This attribute set is used to specify the properties of admonition titles.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Visual properties of hotlinks

refdescription.para: This attribute set is used to specify properties of xrefs

refnamediv.refpurpose: Turns page numbers in xrefs on and off

refdescription.para: When equal to 1, this parameter triggers generation of page number citations after xrefs.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Spacing properties of normal paragraphs

refdescription.para: This attribute set is used to specify the spacing properties of normal paragraphs.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Spacing properties of list blocks

refdescription.para: This attribute set is used to specify the spacing properties of list blocks.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Spacing properties of list items

refdescription.para: This attribute set is used to specify the spacing properties of list items.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specify the root element to format

refdescription.para: If rootid is specified, it must be the value of an ID that occurs in the document being formatted. The entire document will be loaded and parsed, but formatting will begin at the element identified, rather than at the root. For example, this allows you to process only chapter 4 of a book.
Because the entire document is available to the processor, automatic numbering, cross references, and other dependencies are correctly resolved.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Use graphics for callouts?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, callouts are presented with graphics (e.g., reverse-video circled numbers instead of "(1)", "(2)", etc.). Default graphics are provided in the distribution.

refnamediv.refpurpose: First character to use for Unicode callouts

refdescription.para: If non-zero, callouts are presented with Unicode characters starting with the character specified. Zero indicates that Unicode callouts should not be used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Font to use for Unicode dingbats

refdescription.para: The name of the font to specify around Unicode callout glyphs. If set to the empty string, no font change will occur.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Number of the largest callout graphic

refdescription.para: If callout.graphics is non-zero, graphics are used to represent callout numbers. The value of callout.graphics.number.limit is the largest number for which a graphic exists. If the callout number exceeds this limit, the default presentation "(nnn)" will always be used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Number of the largest callout graphic

refdescription.para: If callout.graphics is non-zero, graphics are used to represent callout numbers. The value of callout.graphics.number.limit is the largest number for which a graphic exists. If the callout number exceeds this limit, the default presentation "(nnn)" will always be used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Extension for callout graphics

refdescription.para: Sets the extension to use on callout graphics.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Path to callout graphics

refdescription.para: Sets the path, probably relative to the directory where the HTML files are created, to the callout graphics.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Number of the largest callout graphic

refdescription.para: If callout.graphics is non-zero, graphics are used to represent callout numbers. The value of callout.graphics.number.limit is the largest number for which a graphic exists. If the callout number exceeds this limit, the default presentation "(nnn)" will always be used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable extensions

refdescription.para: If non-zero, extensions may be used. Each extension is further controlled by its own parameter. But if use.extensions is zero, no extensions will be used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable the textinsert extension element

refdescription.para: The textinsert extension element inserts the contents of a a file into the result tree (as text).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable the line numbering extension

refdescription.para: If true, verbatim environments (elements that have the format='linespecific' notation attribute: address, literallayout, programlisting, screen, synopsis) that specify line numbering will have, surprise, line numbers.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Indicate which lines should be numbered

refdescription.para: If line numbering is enabled, everyNth line will be numbered.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Indicates the width of line numbers

refdescription.para: If line numbering is enabled, line numbers will appear right justified in a field "width" characters wide.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specify a separator between line numbers and lines

refdescription.para: The separator is inserted between line numbers and lines in the verbatim environment.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable the callout extension

refdescription.para: The callouts extension processes areaset elements in ProgramListingCO and other text-based callout elements.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Indicates what column callouts appear in by default

refdescription.para: If a callout does not identify a column (for example, if it uses the linerange unit), it will appear in the default column.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable the table columns extension function

refdescription.para: The table columns extension function adjusts the widths of table columns in the HTML result to more accurately reflect the specifications in the CALS table.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The (absolute) nominal width of tables

refdescription.para: In order to convert CALS column widths into FO column widths, it is sometimes necessary to have an absolute table width to use for conversion of mixed absolute and relative widths. This value must be an absolute length (not a percentage).

refnamediv.refpurpose: The default width of tables

refdescription.para: If specified, this value will be used for the WIDTH attribute on tables that do not specify an alternate width (with the dbhtml processing instruction).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Select the paper type

refdescription.para: The paper type is a convenient way to specify the paper size. The list of known paper sizes includes USletter and most of the A, B, and C sizes. See page.width.portrait, for example.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Select the page orientation

refdescription.para: In portrait orientation, the short edge is horizontal; in landscape orientation, it is vertical.

refdescription.para: The portrait page height is the length of the long edge of the physical page.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The width of the physical page

refdescription.para: The page width is generally calculated from the paper.type and page.orientation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The height of the physical page

refdescription.para: The page height is generally calculated from the paper.type and page.orientation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Is the document to be printed double sided?

refdescription.para: Double-sided documents are printed with a slightly wider margin on the binding edge of the page.
FIXME: The current set of parameters does not take writing direction into account.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the number of columns of text on the page

refdescription.para: The specified number of columns of text will appear on each page.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the height of the footer.

refdescription.para: The region after extent is the height of the area where footers are printed.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the height of the header

refdescription.para: The region before extent is the height of the area where headers are printed.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The top margin of the page

refdescription.para: The top page margin is the distance from the physical top of the page to the first line of text (body or header).

refnamediv.refpurpose: The bottom margin of the page

refdescription.para: The bottom page margin is the distance from the physical bottom of the page to the last line of text (body or footer).

refnamediv.refpurpose: The inner page margin

refdescription.para: The inner page margin is the distance from binding edge of the page to the first column of text. In the left-to-right, top-to-bottom writing direction, this is the left margin of recto pages.
The inner and outer margins are usually the same unless the output is double-sided.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The outer page margin

refdescription.para: The outer page margin is the distance from non-binding edge of the page to the last column of text. In the left-to-right, top-to-bottom writing direction, this is the right margin of recto pages.
The inner and outer margins are usually the same unless the output is double-sided.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The bottom margin of the body text

refdescription.para: The body bottom margin is the distance from the last line of text in the page body to the bottom page margin. Note that the page footer, if any, appears in the space between the body bottom margin and the page bottom margin.

refnamediv.refpurpose: FIXME:

refdescription.para: The body top margin is the distance from the page top margin to the first line of text in the page body. Note that the page header, if any, appears in the space between the page top margin and the body top margin.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The default font family for body text

refdescription.para: The body font family is the default font used for text in the page body.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The default font family for titles

refdescription.para: The title font family is used for titles (chapter, section, figure, etc.)

refnamediv.refpurpose: The default font family for monospace environments

refdescription.para: The monospace font family is used for verbatim environments (program listings, screens, etc.).

refnamediv.refpurpose: The default sans-serif font family

refdescription.para: The default sans-serif font family. At the present, this isn't actually used by the stylesheets.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The font family for copyright, quotes, and other symbols

refdescription.para: The dingbat font family is used for dingbats. If it is defined as the empty string, no font change is effected around dingbats.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the default point size for body text

refdescription.para: The body font size is specified in two parameters (body.font.master and body.font.size) so that math can be performed on the font size by XSLT.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies the default font size for body text

refdescription.para: The body font size is specified in two parameters (body.font.master and body.font.size) so that math can be performed on the font size by XSLT.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The font size for footnotes

refdescription.para: The footnote font size is used for...footnotes!

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specify hyphenation behavior

refdescription.para: If true, words may be hyphenated. Otherwise, they may not.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specify the default text alignment

refdescription.para: The default text alignment is used for most body text.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Identifies the output format of this stylesheet

refdescription.para: The extension functions need to know if the output format is HTML ('html') or XSL Formatting Objects ('fo'). This variable answers that question. Valid settings are 'html' or 'fo'.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a table of contents for components?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, a table of contents is generated at the beginning of each component (chapters, appendixes, etc.)

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a table of contents for divisions?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, a table of contents is generated at the beginning of each division (sets, books, etc.)

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a list of titles for Figures?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, a list of titles is generated for Figures.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a list of titles for Examples?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, a list of titles is generated for Examples.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a list of titles for Equations?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, a list of titles is generated for Equations.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a list of titles for Tables?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, a list of titles is generated for Tables.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable PassiveTeX extensions?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, PassiveTeX extensions will be used. At present, this consists of PDF bookmarks and sorted index terms.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable Arbortext extensions?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, Arbortext extensions will be used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable FOP extensions?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, FOP extensions will be used. At present, this consists of PDF bookmarks.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable XEP extensions?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, XEP extensions will be used. XEP extensions consists of PDF bookmarks and document information.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Default units for an unqualified dimension

refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: <xsl:param name="default.units" select="'pt'" doc:type="list" doc:list="cm mm in pt pc px em"/>

refdescription.para: If an unqualified dimension is encountered (for example, in a graphic width), the default-units will be used for the units. Unqualified dimensions are not allowed in XSL Formatting Objects.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Renumber chapters in each part?

refdescription.para: If label.from.part is non-zero, components (chapters, appendixes, etc.) will be numbered from 1 in each part. Otherwise, they will be numbered monotonically throughout each book.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Selects formal or informal procedures

refdescription.para: Formal procedures are numbered and always hav a title.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Name of the bibliography collection file

refdescription.para: Tired of copying bibliography entries from one document to another? Now you can maintain a central bibliography and let the stylesheets do the copying for you. This parameter identifies the file (by URI reference) that contains your complete bibliography collection.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Use an fo:list to format VariableLists?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, an fo:list will be used to format VariableLists. Otherwise, nested fo:blocks will be used.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Characters that count as punctuation on a run-in-head

refdescription.para: FIXME:

refnamediv.refpurpose: Default punctuation character on a run-in-head

refdescription.para: FIXME:

refnamediv.refpurpose: Collate copyright years into ranges?

refdescription.para: If non-zero, copyright years will be collated into ranges.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Print single-year ranges (e.g., 1998-1999)

refdescription.para: If non-zero, year ranges that span a single year will be printed in range notation (1998-1999) instead of discrete notation (1998, 1999).
